data.title: Best Christian Colleges in Arizona 2024
data.meta_description: For prospective college students looking for schools that align with their Christian faith and demonstrate academic excellence, here are the best Christian colleges and universities in Arizona.
data.text:
For prospective college students looking for schools that align with their Christian faith and demonstrate academic excellence, here are the best Christian colleges and universities in Arizona.

Table of Contents

Colleges and Universities in Arizona

Both traditional and online students hoping to attend college in Arizona have a lot to choose from. With both in-person and online degrees at every level of education, Arizona offers educational variety and excellence. Students can choose from associate, bachelorâs, masterâs and doctoral degree programs anywhere in the state.

The stateâs largest university, the University of Arizona located in Tucson, offers a competitive tuition rate, at $12,000, for its 39,000 students.Moreover, Arizonaâs most affordable schools, such as the tribally-owned DinÃ© College, offer tuition as low as $1,000.

Private schools make up about one third of the higher education institutes in Arizona. Arizonaâs private schools offer a comprehensive range of traditional and online degrees from fine arts to naturopathic medicine.

Arizonaâs public universities and colleges, such as Northern Arizona University located in Flagstaff, offer both on-campus and online students a variety of study concentrations, including mathematics, education, political science, and psychology. If youâre looking for flexibility, Arizona has 14 colleges and universities offering entirely online degrees.

Find college admissions consultants in your state.

Arizona is also home to three religiously affiliated schools: Arizona Christian University, Phoenix Seminary, and International Baptist College. While tuition varies greatly among these three schools, each school provides unique degree programs, such as music ministry at International Baptist College.

Arizona boasts year-round sunshine, the Grand Canyon, award-winning restaurants, and several professional sports teams? With more than 30 colleges and universities to choose from, Arizona allows students to get their degrees while cashing in on some of lifeâs greatest pleasures.

If you want to experience the state of Arizona while taking some online courses, you may be able to take a hybrid degree program. Many Arizona colleges and universities allow you to earn a degree through a combination of online learning and on-campus courses.

Arizona offers a variety of excellent and affordable colleges and universities for on-campus and online students at the associate, bachelorâs, masterâs, and doctoral degree level.

What are Arizonaâs Colleges & Universities?

3 Liberal Arts Colleges & Universities

5 Graduate Schools

14 Online Colleges

Arizonaâs Best Overall

The following list of the best Christian schools consists entirely of colleges and universities that offer four-year undergraduate degrees. Weâve identified 3 Christian colleges in Arizona. In order to be included in this ranking list of best Christian colleges and universities, a school must self-identify as Christian, be fully accredited, and offer a broad range of bachelor degree programs.

2021 Ranking Archive

Many of our 2024 undergraduate focused rankings look considerably different than 2023. Thatâs because we took a fundamentally different approach. For 2024 we utilized our Concentrated Influence algorithm, designed to take away the size advantage larger schools have when we rank their faculty and alumniâs academic influence. Concentrated influence highlights smaller schools that are proportionally as successful as larger universities at cultivating influential alumni and faculty.
